name: Seoul & Hong Kong
itinerarySummary: Explore Seoul Gyeongju Busan and traditional markets and palaces
considerations: Well connected by high speed rail and metro
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens up to 90 days
bestTimeDescription: April to June and September to October

name: Istanbul Turkey
itinerarySummary: Explore the Grand Bazaar Hagia Sophia Blue Mosque and Bosphorus
considerations: Straddles Europe and Asia so offers both western and eastern cultural elements
visaRequirements: eVisa required for US citizens
bestTimeDescription: April to June and September to October

name: Berlin Germany
itinerarySummary: Historic sites modern art museums vibrant neighborhoods and a dynamic food scene
considerations: English is widely spoken but public transit requires basic navigation skills
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens for stays under 90 days

name: Budapest Hungary
itinerarySummary: Visit thermal baths castles ruin bars and Danube river attractions
considerations: EU country but uses Hungarian forint not the euro
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens for up to 90 days in Schengen
bestTimeDescription: April to June and September to October

name: Portugal & Azores
itinerarySummary: Split time between Lisbon Porto and a flight to the Azores for hiking and hot springs
considerations: Azores flights limited and weather can shift quickly on islands
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens under 90 days in Schengen

name: La Paz
itinerarySummary: Visit Bolivia's high altitude capital and nearby moon valley and cable cars
considerations: High elevation may require acclimatization travel infrastructure may be limited
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens

name: Poland
itinerarySummary: Warsaw Krakow and historical sites along with beautiful countryside
considerations: Cold weather outside of peak months
visaRequirements: Visa not required for US citizens up to 90 days

name: Hong Kong
itinerarySummary: Explore Kowloon Victoria Peak street markets and enjoy day trips to nearby islands
considerations: Current political tensions can impact protests and stability though still safe for tourists
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens
bestTimeDescription: October to December and March to May

name: Georgia Tbilisi
itinerarySummary: Explore Tbilisi's old town wine regions and Caucasus mountain villages
considerations: Ongoing tensions near borders avoid Russian and South Ossetian regions
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens for up to one year

name: Slovenia
itinerarySummary: Ljubljana Lake Bled and the Julian Alps with natural beauty and compact urban centers
considerations: Public transport may be limited in rural areas
visaRequirements: Visa not required for US citizens up to 90 days

name: Aurora Borealis Viewing
itinerarySummary: Visit Fairbanks Yellowknife or Iceland to view the northern lights
considerations: Requires dark skies and clear weather plan around moon phase and cloud forecasts
visaRequirements: Depends on country US passport holders typically do not need a visa

name: Prague Czech Republic
itinerarySummary: Visit Prague Castle Old Town Charles Bridge and enjoy Czech beer and food
considerations: Gets very crowded in summer shoulder seasons are more comfortable
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens up to 90 days in Schengen
bestTimeDescription: April to June and September to October

name: Morocco
itinerarySummary: Visit Marrakech the Atlas Mountains and the Sahara Desert by guided tour or self-drive
considerations: Dress modestly in rural areas check travel advisories near Western Sahara
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens up to 90 days
bestTimeDescription: March to May and September to November

name: New Mexico Santa Fe Hot Air Balloons
itinerarySummary: Visit Santa Fe art scene and attend Albuquerque Balloon Fiesta
considerations: Balloon Fiesta runs in early October book far in advance
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens

name: Greece
itinerarySummary: Visit Athens and island hop through Santorini Naxos or Crete
considerations: Very hot in summer ferry schedules vary by season
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens up to 90 days

name: New Orleans
itinerarySummary: Experience jazz French Quarter history and local cuisine
considerations: Humidity and hurricane season in summer and fall
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens
bestTimeDescription: February to April and October to November

name: Seychelles
itinerarySummary: Short island getaway with beaches reef snorkeling some hiking on Mahe and Praslin
considerations: October is Creole Festival time trade-wind transitions lodging scarce without booking early
visaRequirements: Visa-free for 30 days as US citizen

name: Grand Canyon
itinerarySummary: Hiking rim views and possible river rafting in Arizona's natural wonder
considerations: Summer heat can be extreme plan for hydration and sun protection
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens
bestTimeDescription: April to June and September to October

name: Croatia
itinerarySummary: Coastal towns national parks and historic sites with Mediterranean climate
considerations: Overtourism can affect peak months
visaRequirements: Visa not required for US citizens up to 90 days

name: Carlsbad Cavern Roadtrip
itinerarySummary: Roadtrip to southern New Mexico to explore caves and desert scenery
considerations: Remote location with few nearby large cities or airports
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens
bestTimeDescription: March to May and September to November

name: Mexico City
itinerarySummary: Explore historic center museums art markets and nearby pyramids
considerations: High altitude air quality and traffic congestion may affect comfort
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens
bestTimeDescription: March to May and September to November

name: Southeast US Roadtrip
itinerarySummary: Drive through Georgia Tennessee the Carolinas and Blue Ridge Parkway
considerations: Plan stops carefully for attractions versus long stretches of road
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens
bestTimeDescription: April to May and September to November

name: Rio De Janeiro
itinerarySummary: Visit Sugarloaf Christ the Redeemer Ipanema Copacabana and hike in Tijuca
considerations: Higher crime risk in some neighborhoods and summer is very hot
visaRequirements: eVisa required starting 2025

name: Israel
itinerarySummary: Tour Jerusalem Tel Aviv the Dead Sea and religious landmarks
considerations: Ongoing regional tensions and elevated travel advisories
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens up to 90 days
bestTimeDescription: March to May and September to November

name: Rome Italy
itinerarySummary: Visit the Colosseum Vatican Roman Forum and enjoy food and piazzas
considerations: Can be crowded in summer and some attractions require advance booking
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens up to 90 days
bestTimeDescription: April to June and September to October
highlights: 2,000+ years of history in one walkable city
World's best pasta, pizza, and gelato

neighborhoods.name: Trastevere
neighborhoods.description: Charming cobblestone streets, authentic trattorias, and vibrant nightlife across the Tiber.

neighborhoods.name: Centro Storico
neighborhoods.description: Historic center with the Pantheon, Piazza Navona, and countless gelaterias.

neighborhoods.name: Monti
neighborhoods.description: Hip neighborhood with vintage shops, wine bars, and a young creative scene.

gettingAround.summary: Rome is best explored on foot. Metro covers major sites, taxis for convenience.

options.description: Most historic sites are within walking distance. Wear comfortable shoes on cobblestones.
Two main lines connect major attractions. Buy Roma Pass for unlimited travel.
Official white taxis only. Fixed rates from airports.

tips: Book Colosseum and Vatican tickets weeks in advance
Eat where locals eat - avoid tourist traps near attractions
Free water from public fountains (nasoni) everywhere
Many churches are free and contain incredible art

name: Egypt & Pyramids
itinerarySummary: Visit Cairo Giza Luxor and Nile River temples with optional cruise
considerations: Travel advisories in effect and safety protocols vary by region
visaRequirements: eVisa available online for US travelers

name: Austria
itinerarySummary: Vienna Salzburg and the Alps rich in music culture and scenic views
considerations: Peak season can be crowded especially in summer
visaRequirements: Visa not required for US citizens up to 90 days

name: New York City
itinerarySummary: Explore Manhattan museums Broadway Central Park and neighborhoods across the boroughs
considerations: Can be expensive lodging and dining high priced during holidays and summer
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens
bestTimeDescription: April to June and September to November

name: South Africa & Kruger National Park
itinerarySummary: Visit Cape Town drive the Garden Route and go on safari in Kruger
considerations: Malaria precautions may be required for Kruger travel advisories vary
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens up to 90 days

name: New Zealand
itinerarySummary: Urban culture in Auckland Wellington Rotorua waterfalls and Southern Alps day trips scenic drives spa and wine
considerations: Long overnight flight and jet lag to overcome always-changing weather
visaRequirements: No visa up to 90 days

name: Argentina & Patagonia
itinerarySummary: Explore Buenos Aires then fly to Patagonia for glaciers and hiking
considerations: Domestic flights often needed between regions and seasons are reversed from the US
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens

name: Indonesia Bali plus Java
itinerarySummary: Relax in Bali explore rice terraces and temples then visit Borobudur and Mount Bromo in Java
considerations: High humidity and tropical weather plan accordingly for dry season
visaRequirements: Visa on arrival available for US citizens

name: India
itinerarySummary: Explore Delhi Agra Jaipur then head to Kerala or Goa for nature and relaxation
considerations: Some areas can be overwhelming for first time travelers prepare for sensory overload and check travel advisories for regional safety
visaRequirements: E visa required for US citizens

name: Chile
itinerarySummary: From Santiago to Atacama Desert and Patagonia explore Chile's stunning variety
considerations: Long internal flights may be needed to see multiple regions
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens
bestTimeDescription: March to May and September to November

name: Japan
itinerarySummary: Visit Tokyo Kyoto and Hiroshima plus temples onsens and high speed rail
considerations: Cultural etiquette is important respect customs and language barriers
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens for stays under 90 days
bestTimeDescription: March to May and October to November
highlights: World-class cuisine from ramen to kaiseki
Incredibly efficient and scenic rail travel

neighborhoods.name: Shinjuku (Tokyo)
neighborhoods.description: Bustling hub with towering skyscrapers, incredible nightlife, and the famous Golden Gai bar district.

neighborhoods.name: Gion (Kyoto)
neighborhoods.description: Historic geisha district with traditional wooden machiya houses, temples, and tea houses.

neighborhoods.name: Shibuya (Tokyo)
neighborhoods.description: Youth culture center featuring the famous scramble crossing, trendy shops, and vibrant energy.

gettingAround.summary: Japan Rail Pass is essential for intercity travel. Local transit is world-class.

options.description: Unlimited rail travel including Shinkansen. Must buy before arriving.
Extensive networks in major cities. Get an IC card (Suica/Pasmo) for convenience.
Clean and reliable but expensive. Doors open automatically.

tips: Buy JR Pass before arrival - it's not sold in Japan
Convenience store food is excellent and affordable
Many temples and shrines are free to enter
Visit during shoulder season for lower prices

name: Disneyland
itinerarySummary: Classic family amusement park in Anaheim with multiple themed lands
considerations: Can be very crowded and hot during summer and school holidays
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens
bestTimeDescription: January to March and October to November

name: Las Vegas
itinerarySummary: Casino hopping shows fine dining and nearby desert excursions
considerations: Extremely hot in summer and weekends are very crowded
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens
bestTimeDescription: March to May and September to November

name: Charlotte
itinerarySummary: Walkable uptown district with museums plus local food and southern charm
considerations: Best visited in spring or fall to avoid summer humidity
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens
bestTimeDescription: April to June and September to October

name: Charleston
itinerarySummary: Charming old town architecture carriage rides and low country cuisine
considerations: Warm and humid summers and potential for hurricanes in fall
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens
bestTimeDescription: March to May and September to November

name: Nashville
itinerarySummary: Visit country music landmarks live shows and southern cuisine spots
considerations: Crowds increase during music festivals and holidays
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens
bestTimeDescription: April to June and September to October

name: Puerto Rico
itinerarySummary: Explore Old San Juan El Yunque Rainforest and island beaches
considerations: US territory no passport needed for citizens but hurricane season runs June to November
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens

name: The Bahamas
itinerarySummary: Relax at beach resorts go snorkeling or diving and island hop by ferry
considerations: Hurricane season runs from June to November travel in winter is best
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens

name: Vancouver & Victoria Island
itinerarySummary: Explore downtown Vancouver and ferry to Victoria for gardens and coastal walks
considerations: Border crossing into Canada may require passport and customs time
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens

name: Singapore
itinerarySummary: Visit Marina Bay Gardens Little India Chinatown and Sentosa Island
considerations: Strict rules and fines apply for minor infractions cleanliness is highly enforced
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens

name: Dubai
itinerarySummary: Visit the Burj Khalifa Desert Safari Dubai Mall and Palm Jumeirah
considerations: Hot weather conservative dress expected in some areas
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens

name: Nova Scotia
itinerarySummary: Explore Halifax Bay of Fundy and Cape Breton Island by car
considerations: Driving required to access many key natural sights
visaRequirements: eTA required for US travelers by air

name: Glacier National Park
itinerarySummary: Hiking Going to the Sun Road lakes and wildlife in Montana's iconic park
considerations: Limited seasonal access and some areas require timed entry permits
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens

name: Banff
itinerarySummary: Hike turquoise lakes and mountain trails in the Canadian Rockies
considerations: Requires car rental for full access some roads may close early due to snow
visaRequirements: eTA required for US travelers by air

name: Belize Ambergris Caye
itinerarySummary: Snorkeling reef diving and beach time in a laid back Caribbean setting
considerations: Mosquitoes and humidity are high in wet season plan for dry season travel
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens

name: Cuba
itinerarySummary: Explore Havana Vinales and Trinidad with cultural stops and beach time
considerations: US citizens must qualify under permitted travel categories and keep records
visaRequirements: Tourist card required even for US citizens

name: Alaska
itinerarySummary: Cruise the coast or road trip through Denali National Park and glaciers
considerations: Weather can be unpredictable and many areas are remote
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens

name: Iceland
itinerarySummary: Drive the Ring Road visit waterfalls hot springs and volcanic landscapes
considerations: Weather can be unpredictable pack layers and plan backup activities
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens under 90 days
highlights: Dramatic landscapes unlike anywhere on Earth
Natural hot springs and geothermal pools

neighborhoods.name: Downtown Reykjavik
neighborhoods.description: Colorful streets with cafes, design shops, and the iconic Hallgrimskirkja church.

neighborhoods.name: Golden Circle Area
neighborhoods.description: Day-trip region with Thingvellir, Geysir, and Gullfoss waterfall.

neighborhoods.name: South Coast
neighborhoods.description: Black sand beaches, glaciers, and waterfalls like Seljalandsfoss and Skogafoss.

gettingAround.summary: A rental car is essential for exploring. No trains exist in Iceland.

options.description: Essential for Ring Road and F-roads. Get 4WD for highland roads.
Day trips from Reykjavik to major attractions. Good for non-drivers.
Quick way to reach Akureyri or Westfjords. Limited schedules.

tips: Book accommodations months in advance for summer
Gas stations have surprisingly good food
Free camping is restricted - use designated sites
Credit cards accepted everywhere - no cash needed

name: Inca Trail
itinerarySummary: Trek to Machu Picchu through Sacred Valley and high Andean passes
considerations: Permits required and hiking at altitude can be challenging
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens

name: Switzerland
itinerarySummary: Ride scenic trains visit the Alps and explore Zurich Lucerne and Interlaken
considerations: Very expensive destination with excellent public transportation
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens under 90 days

name: Costa Rica
itinerarySummary: Explore cloud forests beaches and volcanoes around Arenal and Monteverde
considerations: Rainy season lasts from May to November best to go during dry months
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens for up to 90 days

name: Norway
itinerarySummary: Cruise fjords visit Oslo Bergen and scenic rail journeys
considerations: Very expensive and weather can be unpredictable in shoulder seasons
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens under 90 days

name: Colombia
itinerarySummary: Colonial towns jungle treks and vibrant cities like Medellin and Cartagena
considerations: Some regions may be unsafe due to local conflicts check travel advisories
visaRequirements: Visa not required for stays under 90 days for US citizens

name: Peru No Inca Trail
itinerarySummary: Explore Lima Sacred Valley and Machu Picchu without trekking the trail
considerations: High altitude in Cusco and Sacred Valley may require adjustment time
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens for stays under 90 days

name: Fiji
itinerarySummary: Relaxing island escape with beaches snorkeling and volcano hikes
considerations: Watch for dengue outbreak mid-year petty theft in towns CDC Level 1 cyclone season Nov-Apr
visaRequirements: No visa required up to 4 months

name: Great Barrier Reef & Australia East Coast
itinerarySummary: Snorkel the reef visit Sydney and roadtrip up or down the east coast
considerations: Long travel time and reef is experiencing bleaching events
visaRequirements: eVisitor visa required for US citizens

name: Paris France
itinerarySummary: Visit the Eiffel Tower Louvre Museum Notre-Dame and explore charming neighborhoods and cafes
considerations: Can be crowded in summer book popular attractions in advance
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens up to 90 days in Schengen
bestTimeDescription: April to June and September to October

name: London United Kingdom
itinerarySummary: Explore Big Ben Buckingham Palace the British Museum Tower of London and West End shows
considerations: Weather can be unpredictable pack layers and an umbrella
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens for stays under 6 months

name: Spain Barcelona & Madrid
itinerarySummary: Visit Gaudi architecture in Barcelona then take high-speed rail to Madrid for museums and tapas
considerations: Very hot in summer siesta culture means some shops close midday
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens up to 90 days in Schengen
bestTimeDescription: April to June and September to October

name: Thailand
itinerarySummary: Visit Bangkok temples then explore Chiang Mai and relax on islands like Phuket or Koh Samui
considerations: Monsoon season varies by region respectful dress at temples required
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens up to 30 days

name: Vietnam
itinerarySummary: Travel from Hanoi through Ha Long Bay to Hue Hoi An and Ho Chi Minh City
considerations: Long country requires internal flights or overnight trains weather varies by region
visaRequirements: E-visa required for US citizens

name: Maldives
itinerarySummary: Overwater bungalows pristine beaches world-class snorkeling and diving in the Indian Ocean
considerations: Very expensive destination best as a honeymoon or special occasion trip
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens up to 30 days

name: Hawaii
itinerarySummary: Island hop between Oahu Maui Big Island and Kauai for beaches volcanoes and tropical adventures
considerations: Can be expensive inter-island flights add up quickly
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens

name: Amsterdam Netherlands
itinerarySummary: Explore canals museums like Van Gogh and Anne Frank plus day trips to tulip fields and windmills
considerations: Very bike-friendly city but watch for cyclists when walking
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens up to 90 days in Schengen

name: Scotland
itinerarySummary: Visit Edinburgh castles explore the Highlands and Isle of Skye and sample whisky
considerations: Weather is unpredictable midges can be annoying in summer
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens for stays under 6 months

name: Ireland
itinerarySummary: Explore Dublin drive the Ring of Kerry and Wild Atlantic Way visit historic castles and pubs
considerations: Rain is frequent pack waterproof layers driving on the left side
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens for stays under 90 days

name: Cambodia & Angkor Wat
itinerarySummary: Explore the ancient temples of Angkor Wat visit Phnom Penh and experience Cambodian culture
considerations: Hot and humid landmine awareness in rural areas stick to marked paths
visaRequirements: E-visa or visa on arrival for US citizens

name: Kenya Safari
itinerarySummary: Experience the Great Migration in Masai Mara visit Lake Nakuru and explore Nairobi
considerations: Safari timing matters for wildlife best during migration July-October
visaRequirements: E-visa required for US citizens
bestTimeDescription: July to October and January to March

name: Tanzania Serengeti & Zanzibar
itinerarySummary: Safari in Serengeti and Ngorongoro Crater then relax on Zanzibar beaches
considerations: Yellow fever vaccination recommended safari and beach combo is popular
visaRequirements: Visa required for US citizens available on arrival
bestTimeDescription: June to October and December to February

name: South Korea
itinerarySummary: Explore Seoul visit ancient temples DMZ tour Jeju Island and experience K-culture
considerations: Very modern and safe excellent public transportation English widely spoken
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens up to 90 days
bestTimeDescription: April to May and September to October

name: Taiwan
itinerarySummary: Visit Taipei night markets Taroko Gorge Sun Moon Lake and explore temples and food scenes
considerations: Typhoon season June to October very friendly locals excellent food
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens up to 90 days
bestTimeDescription: March to May and October to November

name: Jordan & Petra
itinerarySummary: Visit ancient Petra float in the Dead Sea explore Wadi Rum desert and Amman
considerations: Stable country in volatile region very hot in summer dress modestly
visaRequirements: Visa on arrival available for US citizens
bestTimeDescription: March to May and September to November

name: Quebec City & Montreal
itinerarySummary: Explore French Canadian culture historic Old Quebec vibrant Montreal and local cuisine
considerations: French is primary language winters are very cold fall foliage spectacular
visaRequirements: No visa required for US citizens
bestTimeDescription: May to October especially September for fall colors
